headline: Why ServiceNow (NOW) Stock Is Trading Up Today
summary: Shares of enterprise workflow automation company ServiceNow (NYSE:NOW) jumped 1.5% in the morning session after Morgan Stanley upgraded the stock to Overweight from Equal Weight, citing that perceived risks were exaggerated.

headline: ServiceNow Stock Wins Morgan Stanley Upgrade On Artificial Intelligence Outlook
summary: Worries over the impact of generative AI on software business models are overblown, according to Morgan Stanley, which upgraded ServiceNow stock.

headline: Micron, Instacart, ServiceNow: Top Analyst Calls
summary: Yahoo Finance senior reporter Brooke DiPalma keeps track of several Wall Street analyst calls on top trending stocks, including calls around shares of Micron Technology (MU) after publishing strong fiscal fourth quarter earnings results on Tuesday., Instacart (CART) — which operates as Maplebear, Inc. — and ServiceNow (NOW). To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Market Catalysts.

headline: MS upgrades ServiceNow on growth resilience despite AI and federal risks
summary: Investing.com -- Morgan Stanley raised its rating on ServiceNow to Overweight from Equal-weight, saying investor concerns about artificial intelligence disruption and U.S. federal spending cuts have overshadowed the company’s steady execution and ability to expand in workflow automation.

raw.headline: MS upgrades ServiceNow on growth resilience despite AI and federal risks
raw.summary: Investing.com -- Morgan Stanley raised its rating on ServiceNow to Overweight from Equal-weight, saying investor concerns about artificial intelligence disruption and U.S. federal spending cuts have overshadowed the company’s steady execution and ability to expand in workflow automation.
